data.title: :memo: Re added troubleshooting Visual Studio
data.body:
Re added troubleshooting Visual Studio installed to a non-standard
location.

data.title: Completely fails to open after latest update
data.body:
```
TypeError: Cannot call method 'getActiveItem' of null
```

data.title: Fix typo in EditorView documentation
data.body:
Incorrect usage of `atom.workspace.getEditorViews()` fixed with `atom.workspaceView.getEditorViews()`.

As a side note, this example should ideally be moved to the `Editor` class and changed to

``` coffeescript
for editor in atom.workspace.getEditors()
  console.log(editor.getPath())
```

given the nature of the example, lest we change the `console.log` statement to something else that doesn't rely on `Editor` as opposed to `EditorView`.

data.title: Dragging Settings tab to other window doesn't work
data.body: When dragging and dropping the Settings tab to another window, the Settings tab in the original window doesn't clear and the new window opens with a new untitled file instead of the Settings tab.

data.title: Console opens up randomly
data.body: I have yet to identify the bug that causes this, but it seems that it has only so far happened as a result of closing a tab that the developer tools is opened.

data.title: Text selected by double-clicking can not be copied by ^C
data.body:
If I double-click a word to select it the text gets selected, but pressing ^C does not copy it to the clipboard, but keeps the old contents.

If I drag-select the text instead, the same key combo does work.

Note: This is in 0.96.0-a83a6e5. I'll try the latest

data.title: React editor cannot open this file
data.body:
``` css
/*
 * This is a manifest file that'll be compiled into application.css, which will include all the files
 * listed below.
 *
 * Any CSS and SCSS file within this directory, lib/assets/stylesheets, vendor/assets/stylesheets,
 * or vendor/assets/stylesheets of plugins, if any, can be referenced here using a relative path.
 *
 * You're free to add application-wide styles to this file and they'll appear at the top of the
 * compiled file, but it's generally better to create a new file per style scope.
 *
 *= require_self
 *= require_tree .
 */
```

Apparently it's tokenizing with an indent level of `0.5`.

![screen shot 2014-05-24 at 8 21 52 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/69169/3074848/90adaf60-e357-11e3-8ada-3829bc5ff9f8.png)

![screen shot 2014-05-24 at 8 22 20 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/69169/3074849/939f15b0-e357-11e3-8c45-c38699c6f2af.png)

Changing the file to 

```
/*
  This is a manifest file that'll be compiled into application.css, which will include all the files
  listed below.

  Any CSS and SCSS file within this directory, lib/assets/stylesheets, vendor/assets/stylesheets,
  or vendor/assets/stylesheets of plugins, if any, can be referenced here using a relative path.

  You're free to add application-wide styles to this file and they'll appear at the top of the
  compiled file, but it's generally better to create a new file per style scope.

  = require_self
  = require_tree .
*/
```

Allows it to open.

data.title: React editor crashes when there is a null byte in the file
data.body:
`echo "\0" > nullbytefile && atom nullbytefile`

crashes the textfield and opens the console, with a bunch of `TypeError: Cannot read property 'textContent' of null` errors, probably because it can't initialize the editor itself and tries it access it anyways. The original error is not shown, as far as I can tell.

data.title: Atom's Install Update and Release Notes feature Not Working in Windows 8.1 Pro
data.body:
### System Configuration

**OS:** Windows 8.1 pro
**LANG:** Traditional Chinese
**node version:** node-v0.10.28-x86
**python version:** 2.7.6
**MSVC:** With both 2010 and 2013 pro version installed
**Atom version:** 0.100.0-00987f3
### Step to reproduce
1. open atom
2. File->Help->Install update/ Release Notes
### Actual Behavior

Install update
1. Atom close itself.

Release Notes
1. No response
### Expect Behavior

Install update
1. Give a message whether it is up-to-date or not

Release Notes
1. Show release notes

data.title: Changes cursor for scrollbars to default.
data.body:
Only to fix the `cursor: text` value in editor when using scrollbars.

Sorry if is already addressed elsewhere. :) very bottom of the list of proposed changes, haha. First day downloaded, very excited.

Was originally going to only put with `.editor .vertical-scrollbar` but saw that the editor's horizontal uses the default horizontal scrollbar also used in file viewer.

Cheers,
Tom

data.title: Make React editor backward compatible with find-and-replace marker views
data.body:
Fixes #2343

Had to detect whether the view was an editor using a class check rather than `instanceof` in `find-and-replace` and add 3 shim methods. We should still switch `find-and-replace` over to marker views but it's no longer a blocker for switching.

![screenshot 2014-05-23 18 57 52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1789/3073231/6040706e-e2e0-11e3-90d3-56c312cdb4db.png)

data.title: Reload grammar in editor when path changes
data.body:
Reloading of the grammar when the editor's path changed regressed in the react editor since it doesn't handle these events yet.

This probably should have always happened at the model anyway.

Closes #2385

data.title: New file saved with a know extension does not select the proper grammar
data.body:
- Create a new file with `cmd+n`
- `cmd+s`
- Save as a markdown file
- Grammar selector still says 'plain text'

data.title: Update linux.md
data.body: so that I could get script/build to run

data.title: Background tips are visible though the react editor
data.body: ![_users_corey_github_bracket-matcher-1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/596/3071660/dcca1700-e2ba-11e3-8f9a-6dfa50010764.jpg)

data.title: Add troubleshoot info about missing https helpers
data.body:
I'm using Win7 x64 with the git-bash with version 1.9.2.msysgit.0.
For some reason I can't build the package because it can't find the https helpers.
I found [this atom issue](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/2206#issuecomment-43443805) which helped me a lot and I thought I need to add this information in the build readme.

Here is my error log for reference. 

```
 (master) /c/OWN/SCM-Store/GitHub/atom/atom$ script/build

Installing modules ✗

> atom@0.99.0 preinstall C:\OWN\SCM-Store\GitHub\atom\atom
> node -e 'process.exit(0)'


npm ERR! git fetch -a origin (https://github.com/atom/bootstrap.git) fatal: Unable to find remote helper for 'https'
```

data.title: Fixed links in docs/README.md
data.body: The links in docs/README.md were relative links(ex: "../foo.html"). I made them absolute links(ex: "http://www.foo.com/foo.html") so they link correctly from Github, Atom.io, and the documentation viewer.

data.title: Update windows.md
data.body:
The build works currently only with node 32-bit version. It's also worth noting
that the shell needs to be run as an administrator or else runas errors
are thrown.

data.title: [OSX] Horizontal scroll bar appears when inputting a greek vowel with tonos (accent)
data.body:
In order to input a greek vowel with a tonos on the greek keyboard you need to press the colon (:/;) key first and then the letter. When I press the colon key I see the horizontal scrollbar appearing and when I press the vowel it disappears.
I assume this is a bug. I can live with it, but it is very distracting, especially on dark themes

data.title: Searching within a .gitignored folder using Find In Project always returns no matches
[OS X] Application doesn't open files containing slash in name
data.body:
##### Steps to reproduce:
1. `echo "Foo/Bar" > Foo\:Bar.txt`
2. `open -b com.github.atom Foo\:Bar.txt`
##### Expected result

Application opens existing file `Foo/Bar.txt` that contains text `"Foo/Bar"`
##### Actual result

Application opens new file named `Foo`
##### Affected version

0.97.0
##### Environment

OS X 10.9.3

data.title: Cursor dissapears when I change language
data.body:
I clicked on a row, and cursor appears. I typed some in english, than changed to russian and typed some. Cursor was still visible.
Then, I changed keyboard layout back to english and cursor dissapeared.

Ubuntu 14.04, installed atom from webupd8`s ppa

data.title: Disabling 'Vim Mode' pacakage disables input
data.body:
If you leave the the modal control provided by the 'Vim Mode' package in command mode and disable the package, all editor panes will be left in an un-usable state where they do not accept any input until restarting the entire app.

On disabling the package, the modal state should be restored to the usual input mode.

Any idea?
Thanks.

data.title: add moveToBeginningOf{Next,Previous}Paragraph for cursor and editor
Prevent React editor's scroll view from being auto-scrolled by Chromium
data.body:
Because we need to draw content before scrolling to it, the editor's scrolling behavior is completely synthetic. We use `translate3d` to move the `.lines` div around and never actually set the `scrollTop` or `scrollLeft` of the `.scroll-view` that contains them.

However, if the hidden input field ever gets out of the visible area of the scroll view, the browser tries to be helpful and scroll it into view, which changes the `scrollTop` and `scrollLeft` and ruins everything. This PR tries to stop that.
- If we do scroll, we log a warning and auto-correct the problem. I'd like to remove this stop gap once we don't see warnings for a long enough time, but it's better than leaving the editor in a busted state.
- When the editor is blurred, we always park the hidden input at 0, 0. This eliminates some cases where the editor could autoscroll after changing size while unfocused and then being focused.
- Allow 2px for the hidden input when the cursor reaches the end of the longest line. This ensures we don't autoscroll to the right when moving the cursor to the right edge of the editor.
